member.name: T:DigitalRune.Windows.Docking.DragHandlerBase
member.summary: DragHandlerBase is the base class for drag handlers.
member.remarks:
The derived class should:
Define its public method BeginDrag. From within this public BeginDrag method, DragHandlerBase.BeginDrag should be called to initialize the mouse capture and message filtering.
Override the OnDragging and OnEndDrag methods.

Calling one of class's constructors, providing the as parameter.

You can access the contained collection of forms through the property of , and you can access a 's containing through its (, or properties.

member.name: T:DigitalRune.Windows.Docking.DockPanel
member.summary: Represents a control that acts as container for the docking windows.

remarks.para: Dockable Windows: A Windows Form needs to be derived from or implement to be dockable. only adds functionality to a . It does not in any way limit the functionality of a normal .

Dock Zones and Floating Windows: The contains 5 s: top, bottom, left, right and document (center). Dockable windows can also be displayed in a free floating window (see ). s and s are container for s.

Panes and Nested Panes: When a dockable window is docked at a certain position it is placed inside a . Each and each can contain multiple s. Multiple dockable windows can be docked inside a single , where they are shown in a tabbed manner.

Auto-Hide Windows: Windows that are docked to the sides can be pinned and unpinned. Unpinned windows are called "auto-hide" windows. They are displayed in a tab strip at side. They can be activated with by a simple click on the tab, upon which they slide into view. When they are no longer needed they are automatically minimized to a tab again.
Drag and Drop: Dockable windows can simply be docked and re-docked at different positions by dragging them from there current position and dropping them at the new desired position.

member.name: P:DigitalRune.Windows.Docking.DockPanel.ShowCloseButton
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the 'Close' button will be displayed in dock panes.
member.value: True to display the 'Close' buttons, otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This flag shows/hides the 'Close' button for docked windows. The 'Close' button is usually visible in the caption bar. This flag only affects the surrounding dock zones (left, right, top, and bottom) and floating windows. Windows in the document zone (center) also have a 'Close' button, which is displayed next to the tab strip. To show/hide the 'Close' button of the document zone use the property .
